column4: In the ubuntu installer I get to the point where it asks for the resolution stuff.  i know this is a stupid question but what do I do?!
Do I check off the one's my monitor can handle? or the one's it can't?
but then it won't display it
Well my monitor can do 1280 x 1024.  It can do 1024 x 768 but when I do that... and it boots... the screen is all multicolored
I mean the multicolors looks like it's displaying something which it can't handle
but normally my monitor prints "out of bounds" if it is
question: I finished installing the distro but there is nothing on the screen when I boot.
uphu try doing a alt+ctrl+f1-6:  Are you kidding or being serious?
I never heard of that combo
that will get you to a console login so you can fix drivers for your vidcard
See, it's plugged into my video card right now
maybe if I plug it into my mobo
